Leveraged ETF General /LETF/

Useful links:
https://www.optimizedportfolio.com/leveraged-etfs/
https://testfol.io
https://www.tradingview.com/

What are LETFs?
ETFs that use derivatives/debt to multiply daily returns of an index (1.25x, 1.5x, 2x, 3x).

Popular tickers
TQQQ (3x QQQ), UPRO (3x SPY), SOXL (3x semis), TMF (3x long bonds), SPXL (3x SPY), SSO (2x SPY), QLD (2x QQQ), FNGU (3x FANG+)


Recommended strategy discussion
HFEA (Hedgefundie's Excellent Adventure) - 55% UPRO / 45% TMF

9 Signal (9Sig)
Quarterly rebalance triggered by 9% growth target. Mechanical, removes emotion entirely.

All Weather Leveraged
Risk parity across economic regimes. Typical: 30% UPRO / 40% TMF / 15% UGL / 15% commodities.

200 SMA Trend Following
Hold TQQQ/UPRO above 200 SMA, rotate to cash or bonds below. Simple, effective, hard to actually follow during crashes.

Buy and Hold
Hold TQQQ or UPRO forever. Historically works over 15+ years but you will see 80%+ drawdowns.

item.title: [TICKER | EXPLODING 28.0/hr] I can’t lose — 7 replies
item.content:encoded:
I can’t lose

Open thread • Replies: 7 • Updated: 2026-02-16 02:47 UTC

OP

Even if crypto is a zero and the macroeconomic environment becomes favorable to international & value, I would still outperform the stock market over the long term because my exposure to crypto is capped & I’m also heavily allocated to AVDV & AVUV & VXUS.

On the other hand, even if the macroeconomic environment remains favorable for high-beta tech & growth stocks, I’ll benefit from the asymmetric upside of BTC/ETH/LINK etc. even if the small cap value premium continues to lag the broader stock market. And it’s not like I have no exposure to S&P 500 companies (VTI).

Even in a scenario involving a broad liquidity drain or a severe economic recession where everything declines in the short term and crypto goes to zero, that environment would ultimately be positive for small cap value over the long run.

And yes I’ve backtested this strategy with portfolio strategy. I’ve decided on a 10% allocation to crypto.

So basically a compensated risk + uncompensated risk but asymmetric upside (crypto) barbell strategy for the long term.

Anyone else doing this?

item.title: [TICKER | EXPLODING 19.0/hr] I think I accidentally built a chain that can’t stall — 31 replies
item.content:encoded:
I think I accidentally built a chain that can’t stall

Open thread • Replies: 31 • Updated: 2026-02-16 01:17 UTC

OP

Been working on a blockchain design alone for ~1 year. Not a fork. Not based on ETH or Cosmos. Entirely custom protocol.
noticed something strange while running validator simulations tonight.
Even when all validators go offline, the chain continues producing blocks.
Not fake blocks. Protocol-generated blocks. Deterministic. Verifiable. No consensus break.
This wasn’t originally the goal. It emerged from how ticket burning and slot timing interact.
Current properties:
> 3-second slots
> leader selection via burned tickets (PoAsh)
> protocol generates blocks if leader fails or no tickets eligible
> chain never halts, even under 100% validator failure
> validators can’t stall the chain intentionally or accidentally

Still has bugs (pic related), but if this holds under edge cases, it removes one of the oldest failure modes in blockchain design: liveness collapse.
Still early. Still finding edge cases I didn’t anticipate.

Next test is validator rejoin after extended protocol-only operation.

posting devlogs elsewhere 'cause I kept losing simulation history when threads expire.

devlogs: https://t [dot] me/+2SXaDc7CMYc4MTZh
posting validator logs, failures, and protocol behavior as they happen. easier than losing everything when threads expire.
can answer here too, but threads vanish.

use case-wise, that makes it more reliable as base infrastructure. most chains assume validators are always present and coordinated. removing that assumption reduces fragility during outages, network partitions, or coordination failures.
not trying to outcompete eth or sol on throughput or ecosystem initially. goal is a minimal base layer with strong liveness guarantees and deterministic behavior. economic layer and higher-level features come after consensus is proven stable.

simulator is partially working now. still testing validator reintegration, fork resistance, and edge cases. if behavior holds, public testnet this year is realistic.
